translation: podżegać do złego, pomagać w przestępstwie [to help or encourage someone to do something wrong or illegal]
sentence: His accountant had aided and abetted him in the fraud.

translation: wstrzymać się (od) [to not do something, especially something enjoyable that you think might be bad; to choose not to use a vote]
sentence: He took a vow to abstain from alcohol.

translation: ostrość [formal; the ability to hear, see, or think accurately and clearly]
sentence: Tiredness also affects visual acuity.

translation: wyczucie [skill in making correct decisions and judgments in a particular subject, such as business or politics]
sentence: He is an astute man with sound business acumen.

translation: wyżej wymieniony [the person or people mentioned earlier]
sentence: The aforementioned Mr Parkes then entered the cinema.

translation: pokrewny, przypominający [having some of the same qualities]
sentence: They speak a language akin to French.

translation: atrakcja [something that helps to provide comfort, convenience, or enjoyment]
sentence: The campsite's amenities include a pool and three restaurants.

translation: jałowy [very dry and without enough rain for plants]
sentence: The desert is so arid that nothing can grow there.

translation: chciwość [formal]
sentence: Her business empire brought her wealth beyond the dreams of avarice (= an extremely large amount of money).

translation: złowrogi [formal; threatening to do something bad or to hurt someone]
sentence: He gave me a baleful look.

translation: koralik, paciorek
sentence: She wore a necklace of brightly colored wooden beads.

translation: oczerniać [literary]
sentence: His accusations were false, but they served to besmirch her reputation.

translation: beztrosko [happily and without feeling or showing any worry, especially when there is a reason to be worried]
sentence: She blithely agreed to the contract without realizing what its consequences would be.

translation: rumienić się [to become pink in the face, usually from embarrassment]
sentence: I always blush when I speak in public.

translation: altana [literary; a pleasant place under the branches of a tree in a wood or garden]
sentence: On the ground outside the bower are two juvenile males.

translation: pan młody [a man who is about to get married or has just got married]
sentence: The bridegroom was late for the ceremony.

translation: klęska, katastrofa [a sudden, bad event that causes a lot of damage or unhappiness]
sentence: A series of calamities ruined them - floods, a failed harvest, and the death of a son.

translation: uszczelniać [to fill the gaps around the edge of something, for example a bath or shower, with a special substance]
sentence: Calk all cracks between the trim and siding or masonry.

translation: bezduszny, nieczuły
sentence: It might sound callous, but i don't care if he's homeless. he's not living with me!

translation: baldachim [a cover fixed over a seat or bed, etc. for shelter or decoration]
sentence: We could see the sky through gaps in the forest canopy.

translation: małostkowy [often expressing criticisms about matters that are not important]
sentence: I only desire to say that this is not captious criticism.

translation: pieścić
sentence: Gently he caressed her cheek.

translation: wybijać, dzwonić [(of a bell or a clock) to ring; to show the time by making a ringing sound]
sentence: Eight o'clock had already chimed.

translation: obojczyk
sentence: The boy suffered a broken collarbone and was taken to hospital.

translation: zarozumiałość
sentence: The conceit of that man is incredible!

translation: knuć, przymykać oczy na [to work secretly to do something wrong or illegal, or to allow something wrong or illegal to happen]
sentence: They accused the government of conniving in drug smuggling.

translation: twierdzić [formal; to say that something is true or is a fact]
sentence: The lawyer contended (that) her client had never been near the scene of the crime.

translation: radny [an elected member of a local government]
sentence: A councilor is a member of some type of governing body, and its definition refers to a public official who is responsible for creating rules and laws within their jurisdiction.

translation: wypowiadać walkę [to try harder to prevent an illegal activity and deal more severely with those who are caught doing it]
sentence: The library is cracking down on people who lose their books.

translation: kołyska [a small bed for a baby, especially one that moves from side to side]
sentence: The nurse rocked the cradle.

translation: szczelina
sentence: Most of the year the insects are hidden in rock crevices.

translation: atrakcyjny, dziarski [old-fashioned; attractive in a confident, exciting, and stylish way]
sentence: She married a dashing young lawyer from the city.

translation: zbezcześcić [to spoil something or someone so that that thing or person is less beautiful or pure]
sentence: It's a shame that such a beautiful area has been defiled by a rubbish dump.

translation: mała dolina [literary; a small valley, usually with trees]
sentence: The dell was carved by a creek that includes two fairly substantial tumbling waterfalls.

translation: wygięcie [a small hollow mark in the surface of something, caused by pressure or by being hit]
sentence: She ran into my car and put a dent in it.

translation: odstraszać [to prevent someone from doing something or to make someone less enthusiastic about doing something by making it difficult for that person to do it or by threatening bad results if they do it]
sentence: These measures are designed to deter an enemy attack.

translation: odrażający [used to refer to people or things that you hate very much]
sentence: All terrorist crime is detestable, whoever the victims.

translation: wyprzeć się, wyrzekać się [to say that you know nothing about something, or that you have no responsibility for or connection with something]
sentence: She tried to disavow her past.

sentence: The delayed commuter train disgorged hundreds of angry passengers.

translation: rów, kanał
sentence: The car left the road and ended up in a ditch.

translation: gromada, stado [a large group of animals, especially cattle or sheep, moving from one place to another]
sentence: People were leaving the countryside in droves to look for work in the cities.

translation: gmach [formal; a large building, especially an impressive one]
sentence: The town hall is the only edifice surviving from the 15th century.

translation: uosabiać [to be a perfect example of a quality or type of thing]

translation: niezmiernie
sentence: He was clever, handsome, and exceedingly rich.

translation: rozdzierający
sentence: He felt an excruciating pain in the lower back.

translation: diabeł, potwór [an evil and cruel person]
sentence: He was portrayed in the media as a complete fiend.

translation: przodek [a relative who lived in the past; literary]
sentence: How the world has changed: occasionally we rediscover long-forgotten truths that our forebears knew well.

translation: ładunek, towar [goods, but not passengers, that are carried from one place to another, by ship, aircraft, train, or truck, or the system of transporting these goods]
sentence: The ship carries both freight and passengers.

translation: zamazany [not clear in shape or sound]
sentence: Is the picture always fuzzy on your TV?

translation: gadatliwy [having the habit of talking a lot, esp. about unimportant things]
sentence: I had talked too much about myself and felt like a garrulous old fool.

translation: trzeć, ucierać [to rub food against a grater in order to cut it into a lot of small pieces]
sentence: Grate the cheese and sprinkle it over the tomatoes.

translation: towarzyski [(of people) liking to be with other people]
sentence: Emma's a gregarious, outgoing sort of person.

translation: trzymający w napięciu, fascynujący
sentence: I found the book so gripping that I couldn't put it down.

translation: płaszczyk, postać [what something seems to be, although it is not; formal]

translation: nieumyślnie [in a way that is not intentional]
sentence: He inadvertently deleted the file.

translation: zapalający [designed to cause fires]
sentence: He gave an incendiary speech at last night’s rally.

translation: ponieść (np. konsekwencje) [formal; to experience something, usually something unpleasant, as a result of actions you have taken]
sentence: She had incurred the wrath of her father by marrying without his consent

sentence: Cases of infanticide often involve extreme emotional disturbance.

translation: zadanie (np. bólu) [the action of forcing someone to experience something very unpleasant]
sentence: Physical abuse involves the infliction of physical injury on a child.

translation: zadedykować, napisać, wyryć [to write or cut words, your name, etc. onto something]
sentence: She signed the book and inscribed the words “with grateful thanks” on it.

translation: niekończący się, wieczny [continuing for too long and therefore boring or annoying]
sentence: The drive seemed interminable.

translation: poselstwo [specialized; a group of officials who represent their government in a foreign country but who have less importance than an embassy]
sentence: The UK has sent a legation to discuss trade and tariffs.

translation: wyrozumiałość, pobłażliwość [treatment in which someone is punished or judged less strongly or severely than would be expected]
sentence: But for the leniency of the referee, the player would have been sent off.

translation: biec susami [(of a person or animal) to run taking long, relaxed steps]
sentence: The lion loped across the grass.

translation: pastylka (do ssania) [a small, flavored candy, often containing medicine, which dissolves when sucked in the mouth]
sentence: The final step sees the candy strings cut into rectangular lozenges, then wrapped and packaged.

translation: półka nad kominkiem [a shelf above a fireplace, usually part of a frame that surrounds the fireplace]
sentence: She has photographs of all her grandchildren on the mantelpiece.

translation: matkobójstwo, matkobójca
sentence: Gerald committed matricide; he strangled his mother.

translation: papka [any unpleasant thick soft substance, such as food that has been cooked for too long]
sentence: If you overcook the cabbage it'll turn to mush.

translation: pesymista, krytykant [someone who says something is not possible, is not good, or will fail]
sentence: He ignored the naysayers and persevered.

translation: skubać [to eat something by taking a lot of small bites]
sentence: A mouse has nibbled through the computer cables.

translation: uparty [unreasonably determined, especially to act in a particular way and not to change at all, despite what anyone else says]
sentence: He's a very rude and obstinate man.

translation: wyremontować [to repair an engine, machine, etc. so that every part of it works as it should; to completely change a system so that it works more effectively]
sentence: I got the engine overhauled.

translation: rozradowany
sentence: Helen was overjoyed to hear that they had given her the job.

translation: widowisko [a competition for young women in which they are judged on their beauty and other qualities]
sentence: Between games, the traditional pageantry includes the parade of champions.

translation: głodnawy (lekko głodny)
sentence: By ten o'clock I was feeling peckish, even though I'd had a large breakfast.

sentence: This attitude still prevails among the middle classes.

sentence: I prodded her in the back to get her attention.

sentence: The appetite, says the proverb, grows with eating.

translation: świętoszek [a person who is easily shocked by rude things, especially those of a sexual type]
sentence: Don't be such a prude.

translation: pić łapczywie, żłopać [old-fashioned; to drink something quickly or in large amounts]
sentence: They spent the evening quaffing champagne.

translation: reżim, dieta [any set of rules about food and exercise that someone follows, especially in order to improve their health]
sentence: After his heart attack the doctor put him on a strict regimen.

sentence: My plants revived as soon as I gave them some water.

translation: odchody [faeces (= solid body waste) left by animals]
sentence: The bear scat was analysed and found to come from a grizzly.

sentence: He was caught shagging his friend’s sister.

translation: udawanie [something that looks like or represents something else]
sentence: In other words, he prefers the bland, dumbed-down sounds which represent a diluted simulacrum of the real thing.

sentence: The cat had sleek fur.

translation: temblak, nosidełko (też: proca)
sentence: I had my arm in a sling for six weeks.

sentence: The birds were soaring high above.

sentence: He will be sorely missed by everyone.

translation: skrzek (ptaka) [an unpleasantly loud, sharp noise made by a bird]

translation: zgnieść (coś miękkiego) [to crush something that is soft]
sentence: Don't sit on that bag - you'll squish the sandwiches.

translation: beznamiętny, powściągliwy [(of a person) calm and not showing emotion or excitement]
sentence: Mark sat stolid and silent.

translation: cieśnina [a narrow area of sea that connects two large areas of sea]
sentence: The strait lies between the Atlantic Ocean and the Mediterranean Sea.

translation: milczący [understood without being expressed directly]
sentence: By tacit agreement, the subject was never mentioned again.

translation: zestawienie (lub: wynik, rezultat) [a record or count of a number of things]

translation: napad złości, furia [a sudden period of uncontrolled anger like a young child's]
sentence: Children often have temper tantrums at the age of two or thereabout.

sentence: I have tentative plans to take a trip to Seattle in July.

sentence: The thorny issue of illegal immigration remains unresolved.

sentence: Trachea is the tube that carries air from your throat to your lungs.

sentence: Turmeric and cumin are often used to make curries.

translation: potentat [a person who has succeeded in business or industry and has become very rich and powerful]
sentence: The tycoon can afford to pay for his entertainment, whether it is taxed income or not.

translation: niezrozumiały [not able to be understood]
sentence: He muttered something unintelligible.

sentence: Many Roman Catholics regret the replacing of the Latin mass by the vernacular.

sentence: The baskets are woven from strips of willow.
